premises: The star is a supernova or the star is a red giant but not both at the same time
The star is not a supernova
conclusions: The star is a red giant
The star is not a red giant implies the star is a supernova
incorrect conclusions: The star is not a red giant
The star is a supernova implies the star is a red giant
The star is a red giant implies the star is a supernova

premises: The planet has an atmosphere or the planet has liquid water but not both at the same time
The planet does not have an atmosphere
conclusions: The planet does not have liquid water implies the planet has an atmosphere
incorrect conclusions: The planet does not have liquid water
The planet has an atmosphere implies the planet has liquid water
The planet has liquid water implies the planet has an atmosphere

premises: The galaxy is spiral or the galaxy is elliptical but not both at the same time
conclusions: The galaxy is not elliptical implies the galaxy is spiral
incorrect conclusions: The galaxy is spiral implies the galaxy is elliptical
The galaxy is elliptical implies the galaxy is spiral
